list_definition.definition: to get or climb up (on or on to)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She mounted (the horse) and rode off.

list_definition.definition: to put (a picture etc) into a frame, or stick it on to card etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We should mount some of these photographs.

list_definition.definition: to hang or put up on a stand, support etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He mounted the tiger’s head on the wall.
They’re planning to mount an exhibition of paintings by local artists.

list_definition.definition: a thing or animal that one rides, especially a horse.
a support or backing on which anything is placed for display

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Would this picture look better on a red mount or a black one?
